# Question

Write a function `wrap_string`. It iterates over words and it will add a new line each time a maximum `text_width::Int=10` would be exceeded. Provide an example

Here is the Julia code for your request:

```julia
function wrap_string(text::String, text_width::Int = 10)
    words = split(text, " ")
    lines = String[]
    line = ""

    for word in words
        if length(line * " $word") > text_width
            push!(lines, "$line\n")
            line = ""
        end
        line *= " $word"
    end

    push!(lines, "$line") # append the last line
    
    return join(lines)
end
```
You can use this function like so:

```julia
text = "This is a long string that we will wrap."
println(wrap_string(text))
```
The output should be:

```shell
This is a 
long string 
that we will 
wrap.
```
